paragraphs.name: 27eb
paragraphs.text: Lottie allows engineers to build richer animations without the painstaking overhead of re-writing them. Nick Butcher’s jump through animation, Bartek Lipinski’s hamburger menu, and Miroslaw Stanek’s Twitter heart demonstrate just how difficult and time consuming it can be to re-create animations from scratch. With Lottie, digging through frameworks for reference, guessing durations, manually creating Bézier curves, and re-making animations with nothing more than a GIF for reference will be a thing of the past. Now engineers can use exactly what the designer intended, exactly how it was made. To demonstrate that, we’ve recreated their animations and provided After Effects and JSON files of each in our sample app.

paragraphs.name: 27eb
paragraphs.text: Lottie allows engineers to build richer animations without the painstaking overhead of re-writing them. Nick Butcher’s jump through animation, Bartek Lipinski’s hamburger menu, and Miroslaw Stanek’s Twitter heart demonstrate just how difficult and time consuming it can be to re-create animations from scratch. With Lottie, digging through frameworks for reference, guessing durations, manually creating Bézier curves, and re-making animations with nothing more than a GIF for reference will be a thing of the past. Now engineers can use exactly what the designer intended, exactly how it was made. To demonstrate that, we’ve recreated their animations and provided After Effects and JSON files of each in our sample app.

paragraphs.text: Awesome to see that more beautiful animations will be integrated in apps. www.VideoIgniter.com is helpful for creating custom After Effects animations. You can sketch out a storyboard, upload it, and have a pro create your animation.

paragraphs.name: 30a6
paragraphs.text: This is disruptive tech! Thanks for bringing it to the world and making it open source. Long live Airbnb.

ef04fe308a27.title: This is the future of software, IMO — instead of taking pixels and rebuilding them in code, we need…

paragraphs.name: 6c7f
paragraphs.text: This is the future of software, IMO — instead of taking pixels and rebuilding them in code, we need to build ways to transform the output of tools that designers love (After Effects, Sketch, Framer, etc) into a form that engineers can easily work with.

paragraphs.text: Great job guys, this looks insane! In my After Effects tutorials for UX/UI designers, the next step designers want to know is how to get their UI animation translated into an app, or at least passed off to developers in a way that they can work with it. Really stoked to follow up with you guys on this.
